did.abstract: Photograph collection of a soldier with the 310th U.S. Engineers, serving near Archangel, Russia in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1919, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by George S. Lilly, of Grosse Pointe, Michigan, in 2008 (Donor No. 10020).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

altformavail.p: This collection has not been digitized by the Bentley Historical Library.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Albert Lilly photograph collection, 1918-1919, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Resident of Detroit, Mich., who served with Company A, U.S. 310th Engineers during the American intervention at Archangel, Russia, 1918-1919.

scopecontent.p: Photograph album containing about 240 photos of member of the 310th Engineers, construction projects, fortification, scenery, Russian people, soldiers of various countries, and ships. The collection also contains a DVD video slideshow of the photos, with some additional content.
